intro: Plancia, commonly known as the marsh helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and showy, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, elongated pods that contain the seeds. Plancia thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in peat bogs and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems.
